text: The 2020 Under-19 Cricket World Cup qualification was an international 50-over cricket tournament played to qualify for 2020 Under-19 Cricket World Cup. ==Qualified teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Region ! No. of teams ! Matches (Divisions) ! Qualified Team |- | Africa | 12 | 35 (2 Divisions) | |- | Americas | 5 | 10 (1 Division) | |- | Asia | 14 | 39 (2 Divisions) | |- | East Asia Pacific | 5 | 10 (1 Division) | |- | Europe | 12 | 35 (2 Divisions) | |} ==Africa== ===Division 2=== It was held in Potchefstroom, South Africa from 19–28 August 2018. The top three teams (Nigeria, Sierra Leone and Tanzania) were promoted to Division 1 where they competed with Kenya, Namibia and Uganda. ====Group A==== {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | |Qualified for ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup Qualifier Africa Division 2 Semi finals |- |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Teams !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" |' || 4 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 8 || +2.323 |-style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" |' || 4 || 3 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +1.247 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 2 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 4 || +0.426 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 1 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 2 || −0.804 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 0 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || −3.489 |- | colspan="8" style="text- align:right;"| Source: ESPNCricinfo |} {| class="wikitable" ! Nigeria won the tournament by winning all five of their matches to qualify through to their first World Cup. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | |Qualified for 2020 World Cup |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Teams !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" |' || 5 || 5 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 10 || +1.237 |- | align="left" | (H) || 5 || 4 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 8 || +2.760 |- | align="left" | || 5 || 3 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +0.581 |- | align="left" | || 5 || 2 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 4 || −0.880 |- | align="left" | || 5 || 1 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 2 || −1.268 |- | align="left" | || 5 || 0 || 5 || 0 || 0 || 0 || −2.668 |- | colspan="8" style="text-align:right;"| Source: ESPNCricinfo |} (H) - Host \----- ==Americas== Held in Maple Leaf Cricket Club in King City near Toronto, Canada from July 8–14, 2019. Canada remained unbeaten in the round robin stage and hence qualified for the 2020 ICC U-19 World Cup. {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | |Qualified for 2020 World Cup |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Teams !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" | (H) || 4 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 8 || +6.514 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 3 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +2.566 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 2 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 4 || +0.259 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 1 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 2 || −2.098 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 0 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || −5.253 |- | colspan="8" style="text-align:right;"| Source: ESPNCricinfo |} (H) – Host \----- ==Asia== ===Division 2=== It was held in Bangkok and Chiang Mai, Thailand from 9–17 December 2018. Mai || by 10 wickets |} ====Semi Finals==== \----- ====3rd Place Play-off==== ====Final==== ===Division 1=== The Asian Division One tournament was played in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia from 12–18 April 2019 It would be the United Arab Emirates who qualified through to their second World Cup after they won all five of their matches to finish ahead of Nepal. \---- {| class="wikitable" |- | |- | colspan="8" style="text- align:right;"| Source: ESPNCricinfo |} (H) - Host \---- ==East Asia Pacific== The East Asia Pacific qualifier was held in Sano, Japan between 2-8 June 2019. Papua New Guinea and Japan were undefeated going into the final game against each other, but the match was scratched and Japan qualified for its first ever Under-19 World Cup after Cricket PNG suspended ten members of the Papua New Guinea squad due to breaching the team's code of conduct, leaving Papua New Guinea unable to field a team for the match. {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background: #cfc;" | |Qualified for 2020 World Cup |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Teams !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=20| !width=45| |- style="background:#cfc;" | align="left" |' (H) || 4 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 8 || +2.409 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 3 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 6 || +3.195 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 2 || 2 || 0 || 0 || 4 || +0.157 |- | align="left" | || 4 || 1 || 3 || 0 || 0 || 2 || -1.714 |- | align="left" | || 4|| 0 || 4 || 0 || 0 || 0 || -2.456 |- | colspan="8" style="text-align:right;"| Source: ESPNCricinfo |} \----- ==Europe== ===Division 2=== The Europe Division 2 tournament was hosted by England from 31 July – 8 August 2018.
